description: The damage to Gazaâ€™s infrastructure from the current conflict is already more severe than the destruction caused by either of the last two Gaza wars.
title: Assessing the Damage and Destruction in Gaza
title_page: Assessing the Damage and Destruction in Gaza - The New York Times
maintext:
Select Map View
Buildings Damaged
or Destroyed Before and
After Change Since
Start of Conflict
Reading the Map
Buildings marked with red circles were assessed as being destroyed or severely damaged through satellite image analyses by Unitar/Unosat. Damage was assessed across Gaza as of August 1.
The areas highlighted in orange show the areas that changed the most drastically between satellite photographs taken on June 28 and July 30.
The areas highlighted in orange show the areas that changed the most drastically between satellite photographs taken on June 28 and July 30.
Drag the slider back and forth to view satellite imagery from June 28, before the conflict started; and July 30, after it was underway.
